title: Case 1: Knee Injury
description: A 25-year-old male presents with acute pain after a football match.
subjectiveEvaluation: Pain worsens with weight bearing. No prior history of knee injury.
objectiveEvaluation: Swelling and tenderness over the medial joint line. Positive McMurray test.
rehabilitationPlan: RICE protocol followed by physical therapy for strength and mobility.
presentingComplaint: Severe knee pain post-injury during sports activity

questions.questionText: What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: A positive McMurray test and medial joint line tenderness indicate a meniscal tear.

questions.questionText: What is the first step in management?
questions.explanation: RICE is the initial management for soft tissue injuries.

title: Case 2: Shoulder Dislocation
description: A 30-year-old female complains of numbness following a fall.
subjectiveEvaluation: Pain and inability to lift arm. History of recurrent dislocations.
objectiveEvaluation: Visible deformity, limited range of motion.
rehabilitationPlan: Reduction, immobilization, and rehab to strengthen rotator cuff muscles.
presentingComplaint: Shoulder pain and numbness after fall

questions.explanation: Closed reduction is the first-line treatment for dislocation.

title: Case 3: Ankle Sprain
description: A 19-year-old male experiences swelling after running a marathon.
onset: Gradual pain with swelling by evening
objectiveEvaluation: Tenderness over lateral ligaments, mild bruising.
rehabilitationPlan: RICE, bracing, and progressive strengthening exercises.
assessmentData: No fracture on X-ray, Grade II sprain

questions.questionText: Which ligament is most likely injured?
questions.explanation: The anterior talofibular ligament is the most commonly injured in lateral sprains.
